Kassiopeia  3
Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

12 namespace {
13  void RandomArray(size_t aN, double* aArray)
14  {
15  for (size_t i = 0; i < aN; ++i) {
16  *(aArray+i) = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform(0.0, 1.0, false, true);
17  }
18  }
19 }

21 namespace Kassiopeia

23  ElasticFerencCalculator::ElasticFerencCalculator()
24  {
25  }
26 
27  ElasticFerencCalculator::~ElasticFerencCalculator()
28  {
29  //not needed
30  }
31 
32  double ElasticFerencCalculator::sigmaeltot( double anE )
33  {
34 
35 //probabilities for rotation: P0(0->2), P1(1->3), P2(2->0)
36  double P0 = 0.144;
37  double P1 = 0.73;
38  double P2 = 0.126;
39 //cross sections
40  double sigmel, sigmvib, sigmrot02, sigmrot13, sigmrot20, sigmatot;
41 
42  if( anE > 0.045 )
43  {
44  sigmel = sigmael( anE );
45  sigmvib = sigmavib( anE );
46  sigmrot02 = sigmarot02( anE );
47  sigmrot13 = sigmarot13( anE );
48  sigmrot20 = sigmarot20( anE );
49  sigmatot = sigmel + sigmvib + P0 * sigmrot02 + P1 * sigmrot13 + P2 * sigmrot20;
50  }
51  else
52  {
53  sigmatot = sigmael( anE ) + P2 * sigmarot20( anE );
54  }
55 
56  return sigmatot;
57  }
58 
59  double ElasticFerencCalculator::sigmael( double anE )
60  {
61 
62  const double e[ 14 ] =
63  { 0., 1.5, 5., 7., 10., 15., 20., 30., 60., 100., 150., 200., 300., 400. };
64  const double s[ 14 ] =
65  { 9.6, 13., 15., 12., 10., 7., 5.6, 3.3, 1.1, 0.9, 0.5, 0.36, 0.23, 0.15 };
66 
67  const double emass = 1. / (KConst::Alpha() * KConst::Alpha());
68  const double a02 = KConst::BohrRadiusSquared();
69 
70  double gam, T;
71  double sigma = 0.0;
72  T = anE / 27.2;
73  if( anE >= 400. )
74  {
75  gam = (emass + T) / emass;
76  sigma = gam * gam * KConst::Pi() / (2. * T) * (4.2106 - 1. / T) * a02;
77  }
78  else
79  {
80  for( unsigned int i = 0; i <= 12; i++ )
81  {
82  if( anE >= e[ i ] && anE < e[ i + 1 ] )
83  sigma = 1.e-20 * (s[ i ] + (s[ i + 1 ] - s[ i ]) * (anE - e[ i ]) / (e[ i + 1 ] - e[ i ]));
84  }
85  }
86  return sigma;
87  }
88 
89  double ElasticFerencCalculator::sigmavib( double anE )
90  {
91 
92  double sigma = 0.0;
93  unsigned int i;
94 
95  static double sigma1[ 8 ] =
96  { 0.0, 0.006, 0.016, 0.027, 0.033, 0.045, 0.057, 0.065 };
97 
98  static double sigma2[ 9 ] =
99  { 0.065, 0.16, 0.30, 0.36, 0.44, 0.47, 0.44, 0.39, 0.34 };
100 
101  static double sigma3[ 7 ] =
102  { 0.34, 0.27, 0.21, 0.15, 0.12, 0.08, 0.07 };
103 
104  if( anE <= 0.5 || anE > 10. )
105  {
106  sigma = 0.;
107  }
108  else
109  {
110  if( anE >= 0.5 && anE < 1.0 )
111  {
112  i = (anE - 0.5) / 0.1;
113  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma1[ i ] + (sigma1[ i + 1 ] - sigma1[ i ]) * (anE - 0.5 - i * 0.1) * 10.);
114  }
115  else
116  {
117  if( anE >= 1.0 && anE < 5.0 )
118  {
119  i = (anE - 1.0) / 0.5;
120  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma2[ i ] + (sigma2[ i + 1 ] - sigma2[ i ]) * (anE - 1.0 - i * 0.5) * 2.);
121  }
122  else
123  {
124  i = (anE - 5.0) / 1.0;
125  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma3[ i ] + (sigma3[ i + 1 ] - sigma3[ i ]) * (anE - 5.0 - i * 1.0));
126  }
127  }
128  }
129 
130  return sigma;
131  }
132 
133  double ElasticFerencCalculator::sigmarot02( double anE )
134  {
135 
136  double sigma = 0.0;
137  unsigned int i;
138 
139  // sigma1: 0.015 -- 0.03; 0.003
140  // sigma2: 0.03 -- 0.1; 0.01
141  // sigma1: 0.1 -- 1.0; 0.1
142  // sigma2: 1.0 -- 5.0; 0.5
143  // sigma3: 5.0 -- 10.0; 1.0
144  // static double sigma1[6]={0.0,0.03,0.045,0.052,0.059,0.065};
145 
146  static double sigma2[ 8 ] =
147  { 0.065, 0.069, 0.073, 0.077, 0.081, 0.085, 0.088, 0.090 };
148 
149  static double sigma3[ 10 ] =
150  { 0.09, 0.11, 0.15, 0.20, 0.26, 0.32, 0.39, 0.47, 0.55, 0.64 };
151 
152  static double sigma4[ 9 ] =
153  { 0.64, 1.04, 1.37, 1.58, 1.70, 1.75, 1.76, 1.73, 1.69 };
154 
155  static double sigma5[ 7 ] =
156  { 1.69, 1.58, 1.46, 1.35, 1.25, 1.16, 1.0 };
157 
158  static double DeltaE = 0.045;
159 
160  if( anE <= DeltaE + 1.e-8 || anE > 10. )
161  {
162  sigma = 0.;
163  }
164  else
165  {
166  if( anE >= 0.045 && anE < 0.1 )
167  {
168  i = (anE - 0.045) / 0.01;
169  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma2[ i ] + (sigma2[ i + 1 ] - sigma2[ i ]) * (anE - 0.045 - i * 0.01) * 100.);
170  }
171  else
172  {
173  if( anE >= 0.1 && anE < 1.0 )
174  {
175  i = (anE - 0.1) / 0.1;
176  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma3[ i ] + (sigma3[ i + 1 ] - sigma3[ i ]) * (anE - 0.1 - i * 0.1) * 10.);
177  }
178  else
179  {
180  if( anE >= 1.0 && anE < 5.0 )
181  {
182  i = (anE - 1.0) / 0.5;
183  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma4[ i ] + (sigma4[ i + 1 ] - sigma4[ i ]) * (anE - 1.0 - i * 0.5) * 2.);
184  }
185  else
186  {
187  i = (anE - 5.0) / 1.0;
188  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma5[ i ] + (sigma5[ i + 1 ] - sigma5[ i ]) * (anE - 5.0 - i * 1.0));
189  }
190  }
191  }
192  }
193 
194  return sigma;
195  }
196 
197  double ElasticFerencCalculator::sigmarot13( double anE )
198  {
199 
200  double sigma = 0.0;
201  unsigned int i;
202 
203  // sigma1: 0.025 -- 0.05; 0.005
204  // sigma2: 0.05 -- 0.randomProbability1; 0.01
205  // sigma3: 0.1 -- 1.0; 0.1
206  // sigma4: 1.0 -- 5.0; 0.5
207  // sigma5: 5.0 -- 10.0; 1.0
208  //static double sigma1[6]={0.0,0.02,0.025,0.029,0.032,0.035};
209 
210  static double sigma2[ 6 ] =
211  { 0.035, 0.038, 0.041, 0.044, 0.047, 0.05 };
212 
213  static double sigma3[ 10 ] =
214  { 0.05, 0.065, 0.09, 0.11, 0.14, 0.18, 0.21, 0.25, 0.29, 0.33 };
215 
216  static double sigma4[ 9 ] =
217  { 0.33, 0.55, 0.79, 0.94, 1.01, 1.05, 1.05, 1.04, 1.01 };
218 
219  static double sigma5[ 7 ] =
220  { 1.01, 0.95, 0.88, 0.81, 0.75, 0.69, 0.62 };
221 
222  static double DeltaE = 0.075;
223 
224  if( anE <= DeltaE + 1.e-8 || anE > 10. )
225  {
226  sigma = 0.;
227  }
228  else
229  {
230  if( anE >= 0.075 && anE < 0.1 )
231  {
232  i = (anE - 0.075) / 0.01;
233  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma2[ i ] + (sigma2[ i + 1 ] - sigma2[ i ]) * (anE - 0.075 - i * 0.01) * 100.);
234  }
235  else
236  {
237  if( anE >= 0.1 && anE < 1.0 )
238  {
239  i = (anE - 0.1) / 0.1;
240  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma3[ i ] + (sigma3[ i + 1 ] - sigma3[ i ]) * (anE - 0.1 - i * 0.1) * 10.);
241  }
242  else
243  {
244  if( anE >= 1.0 && anE < 5.0 )
245  {
246  i = (anE - 1.0) / 0.5;
247  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma4[ i ] + (sigma4[ i + 1 ] - sigma4[ i ]) * (anE - 1.0 - i * 0.5) * 2.);
248  }
249  else
250  {
251  i = (anE - 5.0) / 1.0;
252  sigma = 1.e-20 * (sigma5[ i ] + (sigma5[ i + 1 ] - sigma5[ i ]) * (anE - 5.0 - i * 1.0));
253  }
254  }
255  }
256  }
257  return sigma;
258  }
259 
260  double ElasticFerencCalculator::sigmarot20( double anE )
261  {
262 
263  double sigma = 0.0;
264  double Ep = anE + 0.045;
265 
266  sigma = 1. / 5. * Ep / anE * sigmarot02( Ep );
267 
268  return sigma;
269  }
270 
271  void ElasticFerencCalculator::randomel( double anE, double& anEloss, double& aTheta )
272  {
273  double emass = 1. / (KConst::Alpha() * KConst::Alpha());
274  double clight = 1. / KConst::Alpha();
275 
276  double H2molmass = 69.e6;
277 
278  double T, c, b, G, a, u[ 3 ], gam, K2, Gmax;
279 
280  double sigmel, sigmvib, sigmrot02, sigmrot13, sigmrot20, sigmatot;
281 
282  double P0 = 0.144;
283  double P1 = 0.73;
284  double P2 = 0.126;
285  double Pel, Pvib, Prot02, Prot13, Prot20;
286  double randomProbability = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform();
287 
288  if( anE > 0.045 )
289  {
290  sigmel = sigmael( anE );
291  sigmvib = sigmavib( anE );
292  sigmrot02 = sigmarot02( anE );
293  sigmrot13 = sigmarot13( anE );
294  sigmrot20 = sigmarot20( anE );
295  sigmatot = sigmel + sigmvib + P0 * sigmrot02 + P1 * sigmrot13 + P2 * sigmrot20;
296  Pel = sigmel / sigmatot;
297  Pvib = sigmvib / sigmatot;
298  Prot02 = P0 * sigmrot02 / sigmatot;
299  Prot13 = P1 * sigmrot13 / sigmatot;
300  Prot20 = P2 * sigmrot20 / sigmatot;
301  }
302  else
303  {
304  sigmel = sigmael( anE );
305  sigmrot20 = sigmarot20( anE );
306  sigmatot = sigmel + P2 * sigmrot20;
307  Pel = sigmel / sigmatot;
308  Prot20 = P2 * sigmrot20 / sigmatot;
309  Pvib = Prot02 = Prot13 = 0.;
310  }
311 
312  if( anE >= 250. )
313  Gmax = 1.e-19;
314  else if( anE < 250. && anE >= 150. )
315  Gmax = 2.5e-19;
316  else
317  Gmax = 1.e-18;
318  T = anE / 27.2;
319  gam = 1. + T / (clight * clight);
320  b = 2. / (1. + gam) / T;
321  for( int i = 1; i < 5000; i++ )
322  {
323  RandomArray( 3, u );
324 
325  c = 1. + b - b * (2. + b) / (b + 2. * u[ 1 ]);
326  K2 = 2. * T * (1. + gam) * fabs( 1. - c );
327  a = (4. + K2) * (4. + K2) / (gam * gam);
328  G = a * DiffXSecEl( anE, c );
329  if( G > Gmax * u[ 2 ] )
330  break;
331  }
332  aTheta = acos( c );
333 
334  if( randomProbability < Pel )
335  {
336  if( anE < 1. )
337  {
338  //check if electron won energy by elastic scattering on a molecule; this keeps electron energies around the gas temperature
339  double rndNr = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform();
340  double rndAngle = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform();
341 
342  //generation of molecule velocity by maxwell-boltzmann distribution
343  double Gx = sqrt( -2. * log( rndNr ) ) * cos( 2. * KConst::Pi() * rndAngle );
344  double Gy = sqrt( -2. * log( rndNr ) ) * sin( 2. * KConst::Pi() * rndAngle );
345  double Gz = sqrt( -2. * log( KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform() ) ) * cos( 2. * KConst::Pi() * KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform() );
346 
347  //thermal velocity of gas molecules
348  double T = 300.; //gas temperature
349  double sigmaT = sqrt( KConst::kB() * T / (2. * KConst::M_prot_kg()) );
350  KThreeVector MolVelocity( sigmaT * Gx, sigmaT * Gy, sigmaT * Gz );
351 
352  //new electron velocity vector and energy:
353 
354  //assume electron velocity along z
355  KThreeVector ElVelocity( 0., 0., sqrt( 2. * anE * KConst::Q() / KConst::M_el_kg() ) );
356  //relative velocity electron-molecule
357  KThreeVector RelativeVelocity = ElVelocity - MolVelocity;
358  //transformation into CMS
359  KThreeVector CMSVelocity = (KConst::M_el_kg() / (KConst::M_el_kg() + KConst::M_prot_kg()) * ElVelocity + 2. * KConst::M_prot_kg() / (KConst::M_el_kg() + KConst::M_prot_kg()) * MolVelocity);
360  //generation of random direction
361  KThreeVector Random( KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform(), KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform(), KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform() );
362  //new electron velocity
363  ElVelocity = KConst::M_prot_kg() / (KConst::M_prot_kg() + KConst::M_el_kg()) * RelativeVelocity.Magnitude() * Random + CMSVelocity;
364  anEloss = anE - KConst::M_el_kg() / (2. * KConst::Q()) * ElVelocity.Magnitude() * ElVelocity.Magnitude();
365  //check if electron won energy due to molecule scattering
366  if( anEloss < 0. )
367  {
368  return;
369  }
370  else
371  {
372  //without energy gain due to molecule scattering
373  anEloss = 2. * emass / H2molmass * (1. - c) * anE;
374  }
375  }
376  else
377  {
378  //without energy gain due to molecule scattering
379  anEloss = 2. * emass / H2molmass * (1. - c) * anE;
380  }
381  }
382  else
383  {
384  if( randomProbability >= Pel && randomProbability < Pel + Pvib )
385  {
386  anEloss = 0.5;
387  //std::cout <<"Eloss vib: "<<anEloss<<std::endl;
388  }
389  else
390  {
391  if( randomProbability >= Pel + Pvib && randomProbability < Pel + Pvib + Prot02 )
392  {
393  anEloss = 0.045;
394  //std::cout <<"anEloss rot02: "<<anEloss<<std::endl;
395  }
396  else
397  {
398  if( randomProbability >= Pel + Pvib + Prot02 && randomProbability < Pel + Pvib + Prot02 + Prot13 )
399  {
400  anEloss = 0.075;
401  //std::cout <<"anEloss rot13: "<<anEloss<<std::endl;
402  }
403  else
404  {
405  anEloss = -0.045;
406  //std::cout <<"anEloss rot20: "<<anEloss<<std::endl;
407  }
408  }
409  }
410  }
411  return;
412  }
413 
414  double ElasticFerencCalculator::DiffXSecEl( double anE, double cosTheta )
415  {
416 
417  //double a02=28.e-22; // Bohr radius squared
418  double a02 = KConst::BohrRadiusSquared();
419 
420  double clight = 1. / KConst::Alpha(); // velocity of light in atomic units is 1/ alpha
421 
422  double Cel[ 50 ] =
423  { -0.512, -0.512, -0.509, -0.505, -0.499, -0.491, -0.476, -0.473, -0.462, -0.452, -0.438, -0.422, -0.406, -0.388, -0.370, -0.352, -0.333, -0.314, -0.296, -0.277, -0.258, -0.239, -0.221, -0.202, -0.185, -0.167, -0.151, -0.135, -0.120, -0.105, -0.092, -0.070, -0.053, -0.039, -0.030, -0.024, -0.019, -0.016, -0.014, -0.013, -0.012, -0.009, -0.008, -0.006, -0.005, -0.004, -0.003, -0.002, -0.002, -0.001 };
424 
425  double e[ 10 ] =
426  { 0., 3., 6., 12., 20., 32., 55., 85., 150., 250. };
427 
428  double t[ 10 ] =
429  { 0., 10., 20., 30., 40., 60., 80., 100., 140., 180. };
430 
431  double D[ 9 ][ 10 ] =
432  {
433  { 2.9, 2.70, 2.5, 2.10, 1.80, 1.2000, 0.900, 1.0000, 1.600, 1.9 },
434  { 4.2, 3.60, 3.1, 2.50, 1.90, 1.1000, 0.800, 0.9000, 1.300, 1.4 },
435  { 6.0, 4.40, 3.2, 2.30, 1.80, 1.1000, 0.700, 0.5400, 0.500, 0.6 },
436  { 6.0, 4.10, 2.8, 1.90, 1.30, 0.6000, 0.300, 0.1700, 0.160, 0.23 },
437  { 4.9, 3.20, 2.0, 1.20, 0.80, 0.3000, 0.150, 0.0900, 0.050, 0.05 },
438  { 5.2, 2.50, 1.2, 0.64, 0.36, 0.1300, 0.050, 0.0300, 0.016, 0.02 },
439  { 4.0, 1.70, 0.7, 0.30, 0.16, 0.0500, 0.020, 0.0130, 0.010, 0.01 },
440  { 2.8, 1.10, 0.4, 0.15, 0.07, 0.0200, 0.010, 0.0070, 0.004, 0.003 },
441  { 1.2, 0.53, 0.2, 0.08, 0.03, 0.0074, 0.003, 0.0016, 0.001, 0.0008 } };
442 
443  double T, K2, K, d, st1, st2, DH, gam, CelK, Ki, theta;
444  double Delreturn = -1.0;
445  int i, j;
446  T = anE / 27.2;
447  if( anE >= 250. )
448  {
449  gam = 1. + T / (clight * clight); // relativistic correction factor
450  K2 = 2. * T * (1. + gam) * (1. - cosTheta);
451  if( K2 < 0. )
452  K2 = 1.e-30;
453  K = sqrt( K2 );
454  if( K < 1.e-9 )
455  K = 1.e-9; // momentum transfer
456  d = 1.4009; // distance of protons in H2
457  st1 = 8. + K2;
458  st2 = 4. + K2;
459  // DH is the diff. cross section for elastic electron scatt.
460  // on atomic hydrogen within the first Born approximation :
461  DH = 4. * st1 * st1 / (st2 * st2 * st2 * st2) * a02;
462  // CelK calculation with linear interpolation.
463  // CelK is the correction of the elastic electron
464  // scatt. on molecular hydrogen compared to the independent atom
465  // model.
466  if( K < 3. )
467  {
468  i = (int) (K / 0.1); //WOLF int->double->int
469  Ki = i * 0.1;
470  CelK = Cel[ i ] + (K - Ki) / 0.1 * (Cel[ i + 1 ] - Cel[ i ]);
471  }
472  else if( K >= 3. && K < 5. )
473  {
474  i = (int) (30 + (K - 3.) / 0.2); //WOLF: int->double
475  Ki = 3. + (i - 30) * 0.2; //WOLF: int->double
476  CelK = Cel[ i ] + (K - Ki) / 0.2 * (Cel[ i + 1 ] - Cel[ i ]);
477  }
478  else if( K >= 5. && K < 9.49 )
479  {
480  i = (int) (40 + (K - 5.) / 0.5); //WOLF: int->double
481  Ki = 5. + (i - 40) * 0.5; //WOLF: int->double
482  CelK = Cel[ i ] + (K - Ki) / 0.5 * (Cel[ i + 1 ] - Cel[ i ]);
483  }
484  else
485  CelK = 0.;
486 
487  Delreturn = 2. * gam * gam * DH * (1. + sin( K * d ) / (K * d)) * (1. + CelK);
488  } //end if anE>=250
489  else
490  {
491  theta = acos( cosTheta ) * 180. / KConst::Pi();
492  for( i = 0; i <= 8; i++ )
493  if( anE >= e[ i ] && anE < e[ i + 1 ] )
494  for( j = 0; j <= 8; j++ )
495  if( theta >= t[ j ] && theta < t[ j + 1 ] )
496  Delreturn = 1.e-20 * (D[ i ][ j ] + (D[ i ][ j + 1 ] - D[ i ][ j ]) * (theta - t[ j ]) / (t[ j + 1 ] - t[ j ]));
497  }
498  return Delreturn;
499 
500  } //end DiffXSecEl
501 }

Definition: ElasticFerencCalculator.cxx:23
Kassiopeia::ElasticFerencCalculator::DiffXSecEl
double DiffXSecEl(double anE, double cosTheta)
differential cross section for elastic scattering in m^2/steradian
